Welcome to REST API’s documentation!¶

REST API main¶

REST API repository Contacts¶

async src.repository.contacts.create_contact(body: ContactModel, user: User, db: Session) → Contact¶

Creates a new contact for a specific user.

Parameters:

  • body (ContactModel) – The data for the contact to create.

  • user (User) – The user to create the contact for.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

The newly created contact.

Return type:

Contact

async src.repository.contacts.get_contact(first_name: str, last_name: str, email: str, user: User, db: Session) → List[Contact]¶

Retrieves a single contact.

Parameters:

  • first_name (str) – The first name of the contact to retrieve.

  • last_name (str) – The last name of the contact to retrieve.

  • email – The email of the contact to retrieve.

  • user (User) – The user to retrieve the contact for.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

The contact, or None if it does not exist.

Return type:

Contact | None

async src.repository.contacts.get_contact_by_birthday(user: User, db: Session) → List[Contact]¶

Gets the list of the contacts selected by certain birthday.

Parameters:

  • user (User) – The user to get the contact by birthday for.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

The list of the contacts, or None if it does not exist.

Return type:

List[Contact] | None

async src.repository.contacts.get_contacts(skip: int, limit: int, user: User, db: Session) → List[Contact]¶

Retrieves a list of contacts for a specific user.

Parameters:

  • skip (int) – The number of contacts to skip.

  • limit (int) – The maximum number of contacts to return.

  • user (User) – The user to retrieve contacts for.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

A list of contacts.

Return type:

List[Contact]

async src.repository.contacts.remove_contact(contact_id: int, user: User, db: Session) → Contact | None¶

Removes a single contact with the specified ID for a specific user.

Parameters:

  • contact_id (int) – The ID of the contact to remove.

  • user (User) – The user to remove the contact for.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

The removed contact, or Contact if it does not exist.

Return type:

Contact | None

async src.repository.contacts.update_contact(contact_id: int, body: ContactUpdate, user: User, db: Session) → Contact | None¶

Updates a single contact with the specified ID for a specific user.

Parameters:

  • contact_id (int) – The ID of the contact to update.

  • body (ContactUpdate) – The updated data for the note.

  • user (User) – The user to update the contact for.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

The updated contact, or None if it does not exist.

Return type:

Contact | None

async src.repository.contacts.update_status_contact(contact_id: int, body: ContactStatusUpdate, user: User, db: Session) → Contact | None¶

Updates the status (i.e. “done” or “not done”) of a single contact with the specified ID for a specific user.

Parameters:

  • contact_id (int) – The ID of the contact to update.

  • body (ContactStatusUpdate) – The updated status for the contact.

  • user (User) – The user to update the contact for.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

The updated contact, or None if it does not exist.

Return type:

Contact | None

REST API repository Users¶

async src.repository.users.confirmed_email(email: str, db: Session) → None¶

Confirmed an email.

Parameters:

  • email (str) – The email to confirm.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

async src.repository.users.create_user(body: UserModel, db: Session) → User¶

Creates a new user.

Parameters:

  • body (UserModel) – The data for the user to create.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

The newly created user.

Return type:

User

async src.repository.users.get_user_by_email(email: str, db: Session) → User¶

Retrieves the user selected by certain email.

Parameters:

  • email (str) – The user to retrieve.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

A user.

Return type:

User

async src.repository.users.update_avatar(email, url: str, db: Session) → User¶

Updates an avatar.

Parameters:

  • email (str) – The email of the user.

  • url (str) – The url to get the avatar.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

The user to update the avatar for.

Return type:

User

async src.repository.users.update_token(user: User, token: str | None, db: Session) → None¶

Updates a token.

Parameters:

  • user (str | None) – The user to update the token for.

  • token – The token of the user.

  • db (Session) – The database session.
